intro: Crotalaria qiubeiensis, commonly known as the Qiubei crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand harsh conditions. Its leaves are compound, and it produces pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential pharmacological properties.
